Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
January 13, 2022. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.Specific time frames for each citation as to when
the correction will be completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am unavailable, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except the
following:
R 400.4101 Definitions.
As used in these rules:
(ii) "Social service worker” means a person who works
directly with residents, their families, and other relevant
individuals and who is primarily responsible for the
development, implementation, and review of service plans for
the resident. The definition does not prevent a team approach
to service plan development and implementation.
The social service worker’s duties are not aligned with the definition of a
social service worker in the rules.
Upon review of two CMO treatment reports, it became evident the Supervisor
of Direct Care Workers (Program Manager) also functions as the social service
worker at the facility. The Supervisor of Direct Care Staff coordinates all youth
services, attends court hearings, arranges home visits, makes all of the social
work contacts and documents them in JAIS, and works directly with residents,
families, and the referral source. The assigned Social Service Worker
(Support Coordinator), however, has other responsibilities within the agency
that are unclear. It appears the Social Service worker only signs CMO reports
and has little to no involvement with the youths.
Technical Assistance: The job description for Supervisor of Direct Care Staff
(Program Manager) which was revised in June 2018 does not accurately reflect the
type of children served. The person the supervisor reports to is outdated in the
description. These should be updated.
R 400.4104 Rules compliance.
(2) After being licensed, an institution shall, on an ongoing basis,
comply with the act, child caring institution rules, and terms
of the license.
It was discovered the facility has been providing short-term residential services
for several years, but the terms of their license does not allow for this. If the
agency wishes to continue providing short-term (respite) services, they must
submit a new application requesting a change in the terms and follow up with a
revision to their program statement.
1

R 400.4111 Job description.
An institution shall provide a job description for each staff
position that identifies rules, required qualifications, and lines of
authority.
Genesis House opened in 2014. The job description for Social Service Worker
(Support Coordinator) was developed by Spectrum Community Services in
2008 and was based on the agency’s adult foster care homes. A new job
description for Social Service Worker that identifies duties, lines of authority
and qualifications consistent with child caring institutions and CCI licensing
rules needs to be developed.
R 400.4123 Education.
(2) Provision shall be made for an appropriate education program
in accordance with 1976 PA 451, MCL 380.1 to 380.1853. Each
resident of school age shall be enrolled not later than 5 school
days after admission and continuously thereafter.
One of one open treatment file did not indicate that the youth was enrolled in
school within 5 days after admission. The youth was admitted on 9/13/21 and
enrolled sometime in October 2021. There was no documentation indicating
the date of enrollment or any barriers preventing timely enrollment in school.
R 400.4147 Dental Care.
(2) A dental examination within 12 months prior to admission
shall be documented or there shall be an examination not later
than 90 calendar days following admission.
One of one open treatment file did not have documentation
that a dental examination was completed within 12 months
prior to admission or 90 days after admission.
R 400.4153 Shelter care and detention institutions; preliminary service
plans.
Within 7 calendar days of admission, a plan shall be developed
for each resident. The plan shall include all of the following:
(a) The reason for care.
2

(b) An assessment of the resident’s immediate and specific
needs.
(c) The specific services to be provided by the institution.
(d) Other resources to meet the resident’s needs.
The facility discharged three short-term youth in 2021 and has no short-term
youth currently. I read one closed file. One of one closed short-term file did
not contain a preliminary service plan which was due within 7 days of the
child’s admission.
Technical Assistance – Upon interviewing the Social Service Worker (Support
Coordinator), she said she was not aware that the three youths admitted for short-
term programming were designated “short-term.” She also was not aware that “short-
term” youth require a preliminary service plan within 7 days of admission. If the
facility wishes to continue a short-term program, the Social Service Worker must be
trained on the short-term service plan requirements. *Note – At the last inspection,
the agency was advised to develop and utilize a preliminary service plan template.
R 400.4113(g) Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee
and shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(g) If the employee has criminal convictions, the institution
shall complete a written evaluation of the convictions that
addresses the nature of the conviction, the length of time since
the conviction, and the relationship of the conviction to regulated
activity for the purpose of determining suitability for employment
in the institution.
3

One of one new employee did not have verification that her ichat was reviewed
by the agency prior to hire.
Technical Assistance – To determine if further evaluation is needed, the institution
must analyze all ichats, first to determine if there were any arrests and then to check
for convictions. If there are no criminal convictions, the person conducting the
analysis should date and initial the ichat to verify they checked and there were no
convictions. If there are convictions, the remaining requirements in subsection (g)
should be followed.
R 400.4113(i) Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee
and shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of
human services, the equivalent state or Canadian
provincial agency, or equivalent agency in the country
where the person usually resides, that the person has
not been determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse
or child neglect. The documentation shall be completed
not more than 30 days prior to the start of employment
and every 12 months thereafter.
One of one new employee hired in June 2021 does not have verification that
she is not a perpetrator of child abuse or neglect. No DHHS Central Registry
Clearance was obtained.
Repeat Violation: 12/23/2020 LSR with approved CAP 01/08/2021
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee
and shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
4

One of one new employee hired in June 2021 did not have a performance
evaluation upon completion of the agency’s probationary period.
Repeat Violation: 12/23/2020 LSR with approved CAP 01/08/2021
R 400.4119 Social service worker; qualifications.
A social service worker, at the time of appointment to the
position, shall possess a bachelor's degree with a major in a
human behavioral science from an accredited college or
university or another major with 25% of credits in human
behavioral sciences.
The Social Service Worker (Support Coordinator) hired in June 2021 does not
qualify for the position. She does not have a degree with a major in human
behavioral science or 25% of credits in human behavioral sciences. The
agency did not seek DCWL consultation prior to hiring her.
As of January 12, 2022, the Chief Administrator confirmed that the Social
Service Worker (Support Coordinator) will no longer perform social service
work functions at Genesis House.
Technical Assistance- I reviewed the Supervisor of Direct Care’s (Program
Manager) diploma and transcripts. She has a bachelor’s degree in Criminal Justice
and meets the qualifications of Social Service Worker. As indicated above, the
Supervisor has already been performing the bulk of the social service worker’s duties.
If it is agreeable to the employee and the agency, I suggested the Supervisor officially
hold both roles.
2.) This is not a MDHHS-contracted facility and therefore is not required to comply with
ISEP.
3) This is not a MDHHS-contracted facility and therefore is does not have any contract or
policies obligations.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
1) How to provide verification that ichats were examined appropriately.
2) How to determine if a candidate qualifies for a position.
3) How to fill out a new CCI application requesting a change in terms.
4) How to determine if and when a dental exam is needed for a youth.
5

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
1) Option to add short-term programming to the terms of the license, and what this
entails.
2) Recommended changes to job descriptions
3) Need for Chief Administrator to coordinate with and train Spectrum’s Human
Resources Department on the CCI rules relative to employees
4) Recommended Chief Administrator consult with DCWL to assist in verifying
qualifications of any new potential candidates prior to hire.
5) Recommended the facility be appropriately reclassified as a child caring institution
versus a therapeutic group home, which involves submitting a new application.
6) Recommended staff be trained how to complete a body check and that body
charts be completed on all youth upon admission
7) Provided the proposed new CCI rules to Chief Administrator with some
interpretation
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care or corporal punishment
during this licensing period.
The facility had no violations stemming from investigations or requiring corrective
action plans during this licensing period.
The following rules were cited in the Renewal Report of 2020:
R 400.113 Employee records (i) & (j)
R 400.4120 Supervisor of direct care workers; qualifications
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training
R 40.4166 Discharge plan
6

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
